qas.question: What would more people report themselves as if a more consistent report were considered?
What do people with a high quality of African descent classify themselves as?
How much of the population of Brazil reported themselves as pardo in 2010?
Brazil's population is believed to have between what percentages of autosomal European ancestry?
Brazil's population is thought to have greater than what percentage of European Y-DNA?

context: If a more consistent report with the genetic groups in the gradation of miscegenation is to be considered (e.g. that would not cluster people with a balanced degree of African and non-African ancestry in the black group instead of the multiracial one, unlike elsewhere in Latin America where people of high quantity of African descent tend to classify themselves as <a1_0>mixed<a1_0/>), more people would report themselves as <a0_0>white<a0_0/> and pardo in Brazil (47.7% and <a2_0>42.4%<a2_0/> of the population as of 2010, respectively), because by research its population is believed to have between <a3_0>65 and 80%<a3_0/> of autosomal European ancestry, in average (also >35% of European mt-DNA and ><a4_0>95%<a4_0/> of European Y-DNA).
